sections.description: Smart reset, based on @necolas's normalize but updated to use the system's real values.
sections.markup:
Header

Three years ago, the average person had no idea wh|at a drone was – o|r associated these flying machines with weapons of warfare. Things have changed. Now, unmanned aerial vehicles, or UAVs (also known as drones) have become one of the world’s most publicised and intriguing technologies, used by people in a wide range of professions, from journalism to humanitarian aid work. Farmers have always needed accurate and up-to-date information on the health of their crops and the environmental condition of the land. Agricultural aircraft have been in use since the 1920s, while agricultural experts increasingly use satellites to assess crop health from the sky. UAVs are a natural progression from macro to micro, from large-scale to small-scale farms. While UAVs are unlikely to entirely replace manned aircraft or satellites, they have a number of advantages over these more traditional remote-sensing methods. The technology is capable of collecting very high-resolution imagery below the cloud level, with much more detail than the satellite imagery usually available to developing country analysts. They are easy to use: most drone mapping and data-collection missions are now conducted autonomously, meaning that the drone essentially flies itself, while drone data processing tools are becoming less expensive and easier to use. Perhaps most importantly, drones are inexpensive. In 2016 it is possible to purchase a useful mapping UAV for less than $1,000. And surprisingly powerful mapping drones can be built at home for even less. While processing software can be expensive, open-source and lower cost options exist. Thanks to these low barriers to entry, UAVs are expected to provide significant help to farmers in developing countries, who historically have found it harder to access aerial imagery, either from manned aircraft or from satellites.

sections.description:
Flexbox with inline-block fallback

Display: inline-block; mimics the behaviour of flexbox a bit better than floating elements when you have alternating widths of your grid cells and you want them to stay in line.

If you require your columns to stretch to the full height of your container, use the table and table-cell properties. This will not be a good solution if you want to wrap grid cells on multiple rows but is a good fit if you can control the number of grid cells in a row.

modifiers.description: If flexbox is supported, all children will behave like flex items. If not, children are required to have a `.grid__cell class declared on them.

sections.description:
Pods are layout containers that can behave in different ways. There are several different pods:

  • Regular, default pod used for introduction pod and contact module
  • Hippo pod used for hero module
  • Kudu pod used for handshake module
  • Serval pod used for testimonial module
  • Baboon pod used for introduction pod and contact module
  • Zebra pod used for invitation module
  • Leopard pod used for case tiles
  • Rhino pod utility modifier to be used in combination with other pods, limits to 24 columns wide on large desktop (and up) landscape.

Full bleed on mobile views.

Holds one (1) to two (2) pod seeds. Pod seeds are always half size, stacked on portrait and adjacent on landscape viewports.

sections.markup:
Vooruit met digitaal

Brickson is er voor organisaties die de volgende stap in digitaal willen maken. Met een strategie, digitaal concept, website of een applicatie.

Wat is jouw volgende stap?

Werken met Brickson betekent samen ontdekken, bedenken, ontwerpen of bouwen. We lossen complexe problemen op en werken op project-, consultancy- of interimbasis.

Wil je meer weten? Neem contact op!

Testimonial

Met oog en gevoel voor de mensen in je organisatie gaat Brickson altijd een stap verder.

Case: Evean

Blijer, gezonder en welvarender

Brickson is er voor ambitieuze merken in traditionele markten. Wij helpen ze om relevant te blijven en meer voor klanten te betekenen. Succesvolle merken kijken vooruit en stellen zich de vraag: hoe maak ik mijn klant blijer, gezonder en welvarender?

	$lt-medium-handheld: (

			split: (
				main: ( columns: 6, wings: (0,0) ),
				aside: ( columns: 6, wings: (0,0) )
			),

				main: ( columns: 6, wings: (0,0) ),
				aside: ( columns: 6, wings: (0,0) )
			)
		),
	),
	$gt-large-handheld: (
		default: false,

		rhythm: rhythm(),
		debug-color: #00FFFF, //Cyan
		grids: (
			split: (
				main: ( columns: 14, wings: (2,2) ),
				aside: ( columns: 14, wings: (2,2) )
			),
			tsplit: (
				main: ( columns: 17, wings: (2,0) ),
				aside: ( columns: 9, wings: (2,2) )
			)
		)
	),

	$gt-medium-desktop: (
		default: false,
		columns: 36,
		gutter-width: rhythm(7),
		rhythm: rhythm(),
		debug-color: #00FFFF, //Cyan
		grids: (
			split: (
				main: ( columns: 14, wings: (2,2) ),
				aside: ( columns: 14, wings: (2,2) )
			),
			tsplit: (
				main: ( columns: 17, wings: (2,0) ),
				aside: ( columns: 9, wings: (2,2) )
			)
		)
	)
)

section.markup:
Header

Three years ago, the average person had no idea wh|at a drone was – o|r associated these flying machines with weapons of warfare. Things have changed. Now, unmanned aerial vehicles, or UAVs (also known as drones) have become one of the world’s most publicised and intriguing technologies, used by people in a wide range of professions, from journalism to humanitarian aid work. Farmers have always needed accurate and up-to-date information on the health of their crops and the environmental condition of the land. Agricultural aircraft have been in use since the 1920s, while agricultural experts increasingly use satellites to assess crop health from the sky. UAVs are a natural progression from macro to micro, from large-scale to small-scale farms. While UAVs are unlikely to entirely replace manned aircraft or satellites, they have a number of advantages over these more traditional remote-sensing methods. The technology is capable of collecting very high-resolution imagery below the cloud level, with much more detail than the satellite imagery usually available to developing country analysts. They are easy to use: most drone mapping and data-collection missions are now conducted autonomously, meaning that the drone essentially flies itself, while drone data processing tools are becoming less expensive and easier to use. Perhaps most importantly, drones are inexpensive. In 2016 it is possible to purchase a useful mapping UAV for less than $1,000. And surprisingly powerful mapping drones can be built at home for even less. While processing software can be expensive, open-source and lower cost options exist. Thanks to these low barriers to entry, UAVs are expected to provide significant help to farmers in developing countries, who historically have found it harder to access aerial imagery, either from manned aircraft or from satellites.

Agricultural aircraft have been in use since the 1920s, while agricultural experts increasingly use satellites to assess crop health from the sky. UAVs are a natural progression from macro to micro, from large-scale to small-scale farms. While UAVs are unlikely to entirely replace manned aircraft or satellites, they have a number of advantages over these more traditional remote-sensing methods. Perhaps most importantly, drones are inexpensive. In 2016 it is possible to purchase a useful mapping UAV for less than $1,000. Thanks to these low barriers to entry, UAVs are expected to provide significant help to farmers in developing countries, who historically have found it harder to access aerial imagery, either from manned aircraft or from satellites.

section.description:
Flexbox with inline-block fallback

Display: inline-block; mimics the behaviour of flexbox a bit better than floating elements when you have alternating widths of your grid cells and you want them to stay in line.

If you require your columns to stretch to the full height of your container, use the table and table-cell properties. This will not be a good solution if you want to wrap grid cells on multiple rows but is a good fit if you can control the number of grid cells in a row.

modifiers.description: If flexbox is supported, all children will behave like flex items. If not, children are required to have a `.grid__cell class declared on them.

section.description:
Pods are layout containers that can behave in different ways. There are several different pods:

  • Regular, default pod used for introduction pod and contact module
  • Hippo pod used for hero module
  • Kudu pod used for handshake module
  • Serval pod used for testimonial module
  • Baboon pod used for introduction pod and contact module
  • Zebra pod used for invitation module
  • Leopard pod used for case tiles
  • Rhino pod utility modifier to be used in combination with other pods, limits to 24 columns wide on large desktop (and up) landscape.

Full bleed on mobile views.

Holds one (1) to two (2) pod seeds. Pod seeds are always half size, stacked on portrait and adjacent on landscape viewports.

section.markup:
Vooruit met digitaal

Brickson is er voor organisaties die de volgende stap in digitaal willen maken. Met een strategie, digitaal concept, website of een applicatie.
section.renderMarkup:
Vooruit met digitaal

Brickson is er voor organisaties die de volgende stap in digitaal willen maken. Met een strategie, digitaal concept, website of een applicatie.

section.markup:
Testimonial

Met oog en gevoel voor de mensen in je organisatie gaat Brickson altijd een stap verder.

Case: Evean
section.renderMarkup:
Testimonial

Met oog en gevoel voor de mensen in je organisatie gaat Brickson altijd een stap verder.

Case: Evean

section.markup:
Blijer, gezonder en welvarender

Brickson is er voor ambitieuze merken in traditionele markten. Wij helpen ze om relevant te blijven en meer voor klanten te betekenen. Succesvolle merken kijken vooruit en stellen zich de vraag: hoe maak ik mijn klant blijer, gezonder en welvarender?

{$modifiers}
section.renderMarkup:
Blijer, gezonder en welvarender

Brickson is er voor ambitieuze merken in traditionele markten. Wij helpen ze om relevant te blijven en meer voor klanten te betekenen. Succesvolle merken kijken vooruit en stellen zich de vraag: hoe maak ik mijn klant blijer, gezonder en welvarender?

{$modifiers}

section.markup:
Blijer, gezonder en welvarender

Waar draait digitaal om? Slimme organisaties begrijpen mensen én techniek. Ze weten dat het digitale landschap het belangrijkste speelveld voor innovatie is. Maar bovenal weten ze wat hun klant van ze verwacht en gaat verwachten.

In goed gezelschap

section.markup:
Vooruit met digitaal

Brickson is er voor organisaties die de volgende stap in digitaal willen maken. Met een strategie, digitaal concept, website of een applicatie.

Wat is jouw volgende stap?

Werken met Brickson betekent samen ontdekken, bedenken, ontwerpen of bouwen. We lossen complexe problemen op en werken op project-, consultancy- of interimbasis.

Wil je meer weten? Neem contact op!

Testimonial

Met oog en gevoel voor de mensen in je organisatie gaat Brickson altijd een stap verder.

Case: Evean

Blijer, gezonder en welvarender

Brickson is er voor ambitieuze merken in traditionele markten. Wij helpen ze om relevant te blijven en meer voor klanten te betekenen. Succesvolle merken kijken vooruit en stellen zich de vraag: hoe maak ik mijn klant blijer, gezonder en welvarender?
